Canvas for To Belgium and Back with the 79th Infantry Division

body.value: Cartoon of division units chasing fleeing Germans northeast after crossing the Seine.  Captions "Upon breaking out of the Seine Bridgehead the division started a record breaking advance - destination - Belgium" and "One of the fastest advances of comparable distance by any infantry division in wartime."
Men loading and unloading trucks near Chalons
German combat team (Team Wetzel) cut off near Neufchateau on September 14.  Commander Col. Wetzel negotiated the terms of the surrender of his unit.
"On September 12 the 341 Inf, disregarding blown bridges and bullets, battered across to the first Moselle Bridgehead"
Cartoon of mortar unit firing and infantry advancing
"On October 24, after 127 days of continuous combat, the division was relieved and moved into assembly south of Luneville"
Unit crest of the 79th Infantry Division (the Cross of Lorraine). Hand written "map no. 2"
